uniol.apt.adt.automaton

Class DFAState

extends java.lang.Object
    A state of a DeterministicFiniteAutomaton.
    Author:
    Uli Schlachter

    • Constructor Detail

      • DFAState

        public DFAState()

    • Method Detail

      • getFollowingState

        public abstract DFAState getFollowingState(Symbol atom)
        Get the state that is reached by some symbol. This function can also be called for symbols which are not returned by getDefinedSymbols. However, no such symbols which may have transitions.
        Parameters:
        atom - The symbol which should be followed.
        Returns:
        the state that is reached or null if the atom is epsilon or not in the alphabet.

      • getFollowingStates

        public final java.util.Set<uniol.apt.adt.automaton.State> getFollowingStates(Symbol atom)
        Get the states that are reached by some symbol. This function can also be called for symbols which are not returned by getDefinedSymbols. However, epsilon is the only symbol which may have transitions. All other symbols must reach the empty set.
        Parameters:
        atom - The symbol which should be followed.
        Returns:
        States that are reached by the given symbol which may be the empty set.

      • isFinalState

        public boolean isFinalState()
        Is this state a final state?
        Returns:
        true iff this state is a final state.

      • getDefinedSymbols

        public java.util.Set<Symbol> getDefinedSymbols()
        Get the symbols for which transitions are defined. This function will never return the epsilon symbol. Instead, this symbol should automatically be assumed.
        Returns:
        Symbols for which there are transitions.
